reviews:
It includes a USB cable but there's no place to plug it in. Why??

I tried two 18650 batteries with button top. The first battery will only work if I unscrew the back cap a half turn. Otherwise it won't turn on. That is a Pelican battery, good quality. The second battery will only work if I jiggle the back cap or unscrew it slightly (not a half turn like the Pelican, maybe just a quarter turn). If I just tighten it down then the light will only sometimes turn on. I also ordered two Panasonic batteries for this light but they haven't arrived yet so I don't know if they will be any better.

That's too bad. This seems like a good light, if it worked. Compared to my $109 Pelican 7600 this one is much smaller and just as bright. But it's not working correctly so I can't keep it. The Pelican 7600 is perfect other than the larger size.

I just ordered the MH12GT with built in charger. Hopefully that one will work without having to loosen the rear cap.

Quick update... I just received the MH12GT and that light is fantastic. Absolutely awesome. I think I just got a bad P12GT but I'm happier with the MH12GT anyway because it has the built in charger and seems to be the same size -- if not it's extremely close in size.

#137,763 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#1,251 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Unlike many of the generics and knockoffs on Amazon, Nitecore is recognized by flashlight enthusiasts as a legit (though perhaps a bit overpriced) flashlight company. As a city dweller, even with all the other light around this one is pretty amazing to use. Easily lights up to the end of my block. It's like taking a portable spotlight to the park. Easily fits in my pocket. 4 stars because it definitely doesn't reach the 300+ yards nitecore claims, somewhere in the 200s. I compared it to the  EagleTac DX30LC2 CREE XP-L HI V3  and while the eagtac claims 1160 lumens vs this nitecore's 1000 I could not notice a difference just eyeing it.
The Side switch is a huge plus for me. You still use the bottom switch to turn it on, but the side switch to go through the various modes. I hate using bottom clickers to rotate through various modes.
I'd say this is the easily one of the best flashlights you can buy in the $70 range. Uses an 18650 battery, I definitely recommend using a US based retailer for buying 18650 batteries, you do not want to wind up with a low quality generic or counterfeit.
product_name: Nitecore P12Gt Flashlight Cree XP-L Hi V3 LED-with Free Andrew & Amanda Pen, 1000 lm
rank:
#137,763 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#1,251 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Buy with confidence, Nitecore honors lifetime warranty.
I bought SRT5 flashlight a couple of years ago and carried it every day. It survived many falls, mud, and water. However a couple of weeks ago it quit after a fall from 1.5 feet. I contacted Nitecore via email and they asked me to contact and send the light to Edison Bright, the distributor I had bought it from. Edison Bright gave me the return instructions, I returned the light and today received a brand new one. Great service, especially considering that SRT5 is no longer available (at least on Amazon).

In the meantime I ordered P12Gt. So far it works fine and was in my pocket every day while I was waiting for SRT5 replacement. I like the tactical ring. It also solved a problem I reported with SRT5. I attached the lanyard to the ring, instead of the whole on the tailcap. This allows me to stand the light on its tailcap, which is useful for turning it into a lantern. Not a big deal, but sometimes convenient.

I do find SRT5 ring more useful to switch modes than the side button on PT12. SRT5 allows to select the mode or light intensity prior to turning it on, whereas you must switch on PT12 and then adjust brightness. PT12 remembers the last setting, so if you set it to low mode, turned it off, and than back on, it will be on low mode. I like to carry the light on max brightness for tactical reasons. However, in many situations and especially at night in-doors or in a tent i want it on on a low setting. Easy to do with SRT5, can't do with PT12Gt.
product_name: Nitecore P12Gt Flashlight Cree XP-L Hi V3 LED-with Free Andrew & Amanda Pen, 1000 lm

reviews: Love this freakin flashlight. Fits well in a front pocket and goes everywhere with me. The light output is unbelievable. My friend is always bragging about his Streamlight (double the price). Showed him the output and he was blown away. This thing is tough as nails. It came with 2 CR123 batteries. I have been using it for a few months now on those same batteries and have noticed no decrease in output. I like that it is 18650 compatible. Those batteries are cheap, rechargeable, and last forever. Will switch to them once the originals wear out. Just enough weight to it that it could be used as a weapon in a pinch. The tailcap switch is a feature that you wont want to do without. My last one did not have this and I was always searching for the switch on the barrel. I have other Nitcore products; mostly caribiners etc. All are high quality just like this flashlight. You wont be sorry.

reviews:
The product is excellent. I like the fact that the manufacturer stands behind the product.....because, after a year or so, it started to mis-behave. The U. S. seller (in Austin, Texas) was very helpful, and replaced the head at no charge. Works great now.

This is a very good tac light. When I first tried it, I could light up objects over 100 yards away in the Arizona desert. It gets a bit hot when you do that, but now I run at a lower power, knowing that I can use full brightness when I need it. I like that fact that the on/off switch is protected and it takes some work to activate. This prevents accidental turning on, which has ruined a number of LED flashlights for me in the past.

I'm using the rechargeable 18650 batteries.

review_title: Puts my other flashlights on the back shelf
reviews:
This is the 2nd Nitecore flashlight that I have purchased. The first one was a mere 170 lumins. Good for basic stuff and extremely well made. This unit is typical Nitecore quality. Solid, and well built. When you first turn it on, you can see the brightness of the lamp. I am a maintenance technician and at times need to inspect tools. Shining this light inside a tool, brightens the entire area. No dead spots.
I purchased this light to be primarily for fishing at night, to use to guide the boat around obstructions, but I can easily see this will be my go to light for quite a while.
For anyone looking for a solidly built, dependable, and super bright flashlight, I highly recommend this light.

review_title: Very sturdy and super bright flashlight!
reviews:
This 1000lm Nitecore flashlight is superb. It is very robust and solid. I like the different brightness settings of the lamp. This helps to adjust the amount of light that is needed to the situation you will find yourself in it. I often visit established suppliers or prospective suppliers and make facility tours. This lamp comes very handy when I want to look closer at a part on the shop floor and the lighting is not the best.

I carry the flashlight everyday in my office backpack. The lamp itself gets delivered with a case to attach it to your belt, a small lanyard, a pocket clip and some spare gaskets.

I highly recommend this flashlight to anyone who is looking for a sturdy, adjustable and bright flashlight.

#137,763 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#1,251 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Wonderful hard use light for EDC and night hiking/camping
reviews:
Second P12GT I've owned. I have the first one to my father because I loved it so much, and he did too!
Throw: I go hiking often and at night, the ability to illuminate a hill 350-400m out is very helpful at night when trying to decide which route to take. I have no trouble making out details at 75-150m, and at 200m+ I can see major features near the hotspot, and a decent amount in the food.
Battery life: honestly depends on what 18650 you get, but in my experiences with the light, I can get a full two days of hard use before having to charge it.
Durability: solid solid solid! My previous light has been dropped 30ft, submerged, scraped and subjected to temperatures of 106F with no damage besides character marks (minor scratches).
Overall I love the light and I would highly recommend it to someone who needs a durable light or an edc light.

review_title: which I love, and got this one as a backup/spare flashlight
reviews:
I have a Nitecore P10, which I love, and got this one as a backup/spare flashlight.

Compared to the P10, the P12GT's light is a more clearly defined circle and brighter at the highest setting. It also has a longer throw distance.

Thought the P10 lasts a lot longer and is easier to control with the mode lever button, the P12GT serves well for when I need more performance over longer distances. Nitecore has never let me down with their flashlights, chargers, and batteries.

review_title: Good light but not the light in description
reviews:
Ordered the light because description had the specs for the most recent p12gt. I received the older one with the 320m on the front of the box. I just wanted to make other customers aware of the disconnect.

The light I did receive was solid and bright. I clicked through all the functions to make sure I still wanted the newer version. No surprises, good light, easy to use, mostly useful modes. It has a generous number threads unlike many lights out there, I like this.

Alas, it wasn’t what the description contained. I returned it. Amazon seems to be slipping, this is happening with increasing frequency. I’m no longer confident in the accuracy of listings anymore.

review_title: New clip design is a big improvement!
reviews:
I've got a couple of P12's mounted on rifles, but wanted to try the P12GT for everyday carry.

I carry my light clipped in my cargo pocket, and the clip of the GT lets the light ride lower in my pocket than the clip on the original P12. This is a significant improvement.

All of the Nitecore lights I have owned have been excellent and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them to anybody that needs a durable pocket spotlight.

reviews: Kudos to Nitecore for making a great EDC flashlight,and at a great value. This light has four different lumen settings and three different modes (Strobe, SOS, Beacon). The build and feel of this light is impressive (definitely seems durable), as are the accessories you can get for it. This light is easy to hang on to, and easy to set and recall different brightness's and modes thanks to the well thought functionality of the mode switch; I wish my SF lights had this! The crenulated bezel gives it some offensive capability which is a plus for an EDC. The holster it comes with is adaptable for any mount (MOLLE, belts, karabiner) and the duel-stage pocket clip keeps it secure sans holster. Best part is it can handle the higher voltage rechargeable batteries some other LED lights cannot.

review_title: I'm going to be returning the light for one that's not been previously enjoyed. Other than that
reviews: I ordered this flashlight a few days ago to use at work. It arrived fast but upon opening the package I found a used flashlight with several dings from use and being dropped. It also has a few wear marks from use. I'm going to be returning the light for one that's not been previously enjoyed. Other than that, I gave it 2 stars for it being incredibly bright. Would have got 5 had I not received a used light.

review_title: its like comparing a Galaxy S8 to a slide rule
reviews:
It is a flashlight. If you compare it to a flashlight of the early 1970s, its like comparing a Galaxy S8 to a slide rule. But its still just a flashlight for like, seventy bucks. I have no idea if it has tactical value. If someone is threatening me, and I shine it in his eyes, it may disorient him for a few seconds while I try and run away, or piss him off a lot more and then he also takes your flashlight as well as beating you.

However if you are tying to find some freshly laid dog eggs in a pile of fall leaves, it is the second best thing you can use other than a Seek Thermal cam, which literally makes it glow for you. Its fun to use for night photography and video as well, but it can overexpose the shot as whatever you are pointing it at is quite bright. Especially if it has an insane albedo like a stop sign.
product_name: Nitecore P12Gt Flashlight Cree XP-L Hi V3 LED-with Free Andrew & Amanda Pen, 1000 lm
rank:
#137,763 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#1,251 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Pros,
- Very narrow beam, (may be a Con if you want a flood)
- Very long distance throw,
- Very bright.
- The battery voltage indicator is a very nice feature that no one else has (that I know of) and is dead accurate as compared to a Fluke true RMS Multi-meter.
- It has a locator beacon feature that looks like a camera flash going off every 2 seconds.
- Mode button is raised and rubber, so its very easy to find by feel, even with gloves (though harder indeed)
- No ANOYING!!! strobe in the normal mode cycling (but can be easily programed as the first thing that comes on)
Cons:
- Has a ~500 ms delay when activated. Not IOL (Instant on lighting {Ref. movie 'The Money Pit'} :)
- Checkered knurling grip is too slippery, seems its just for looks, not for a non-slip grip.
- Tail cap does not taper inward to assist in slipping into a case or pouch or pocket, snags on everything- very annoying
- Tail stand is possible if your really careful and don't move or even blink cause if you do it will tip over.
- Only accepts 'button top ' batteries. So vapers beware, No compatibility with your Batteries.
-Oh yeah...No Pen, Damn it!

-Update 11-07-15 : So the light had to go back. I ran it on high (1000 lm) for a while and was expecting the heat sensor to shut it down or go to a lower setting, well it did, then went bright again, then went dim again and so on and so on. now it has 2 brightness levels, low and (almost) high. In other words as you cycle through the levels its low-High-High-High-low. The high is more like 700 lm though not full on 1000 like before. I think the heat protection feature failed and the circuit board suffered from overheating. sending back, Amazon has a new one on the way. So 3 stars for now
